icon: The icon is circular, with a white background featuring black lines that resemble bamboo shoots or leaves radiating outwards from the center. The circle itself has two small dots on either side of it, also colored black. Atop these dots sit two smaller circles, each filled with a different shade of green - one darker than the other. These circles appear to be floating above their respective dots as if they were balloons. 

In addition to all this, there's another element at play here – text! Scattered across the top edge of the icon are three words "Google Maps", rendered in bold letters against a contrasting red backdrop. This text seems to serve both decorative purposes by breaking up the otherwise monochromatic design but also functional ones given its association with Google Maps.

Overall, while simple in terms of colors used (black, white, shades of green), the icon packs quite a punch when it comes to symbolism associated with location services like Google Maps. It's more than just an abstract representation; every detail serves a purpose, whether explicit ("Google Maps") or implied through visual cues such as the bamboo-like shapes suggesting growth and directionality.
